except(*keys)

Returns a new hash without the given keys.

[Source]

    # File vendor/plugins/will_paginate/lib/will_paginate/core_ext.rb, line 7
 7:     def except(*keys)
 8:       rejected = Set.new(respond_to?(:convert_key) ? keys.map { |key| convert_key(key) } : keys)
 9:       reject { |key,| rejected.include?(key) }
10:     end
except!(*keys)

Replaces the hash without only the given keys.

[Source]

    # File vendor/plugins/will_paginate/lib/will_paginate/core_ext.rb, line 13
13:     def except!(*keys)
14:       replace(except(*keys))
15:     end
paginate(options_or_page = {}, per_page = nil)

[Source]

    # File vendor/plugins/will_paginate/lib/will_paginate/core_ext.rb, line 57
57:     def paginate(options_or_page = {}, per_page = nil)
58:       if options_or_page.nil? or Fixnum === options_or_page
59:         if defined? WillPaginate::Deprecation
60:           WillPaginate::Deprecation.warn "Array#paginate now conforms to the main, ActiveRecord::Base#paginate API.  You should \\\ncall it with a parameters hash (:page, :per_page).  The old API (numbers as arguments) \\\nhas been deprecated and is going to be unsupported in future versions of will_paginate.\n"
61:         end
62:         page = options_or_page
63:         options = {}
64:       else
65:         options = options_or_page
66:         page = options[:page]
67:         raise ArgumentError, "wrong number of arguments (1 hash or 2 Fixnums expected)" if per_page
68:         per_page = options[:per_page]
69:       end
70: 
71:       WillPaginate::Collection.create(page || 1, per_page || 30, options[:total_entries] || size) do |pager|
72:         pager.replace self[pager.offset, pager.per_page].to_a
73:       end
74:     end
rec_merge!(other)

Same as Hash#merge!, but recursively merges sub-hashes (stolen from Haml)

[Source]

    # File vendor/plugins/will_paginate/lib/will_paginate/core_ext.rb, line 38
38:     def rec_merge!(other)
39:       other.each do |key, other_value|
40:         value = self[key]
41:         if value.is_a?(Hash) and other_value.is_a?(Hash)
42:           value.rec_merge! other_value
43:         else
44:           self[key] = other_value
45:         end
46:       end
47:       self
48:     end
slice(*keys)

Returns a new hash with only the given keys.

[Source]

    # File vendor/plugins/will_paginate/lib/will_paginate/core_ext.rb, line 22
22:     def slice(*keys)
23:       allowed = Set.new(respond_to?(:convert_key) ? keys.map { |key| convert_key(key) } : keys)
24:       reject { |key,| !allowed.include?(key) }
25:     end
